title: Bay County Sheriffs Deputies Rescue 2 Men From Sinking Pontoon Boat On Saginaw Bay.html
content: Ann Arbor Flint Grand Rapids/Muskegon Jackson Kalamazoo Saginaw/Bay City All Michigan Saginaw and Bay City News **Bay County Sheriff’s deputies rescue 2 men from sinking pontoon boat on Saginaw Bay** Updated:Jun. 11, 2025, 3:14 p.m. |Published:Jun. 11, 2025, 2:01 p.m. Jeff Schrier | Mlive.com MLive file photo.The Saginaw News/MLive.com Cole Waterman | Cole_Waterman@mlive.com HAMPTON TWP, MI — Bay County Sheriff’s deputies have rescued two men from their sinking pontoon boat in the Saginaw Bay. About 8:45 a.m. on Saturday, June 7, the office’s Marine Patrol Division responded to an emergency call from the two men. They were about two miles into the bay from Finn Road in Hampton Township, said Sheriff Troy R. Cunningham. Deputies soon located the two men, ages 46 and 61, and successfully rescued them from the sinking pontoon. One of the men was a quadriplegic in a wheelchair, the sheriff added. The pontoon finished sinking once the two marooned men were in deputies’ boat, Cunningham said. It has since been recovered. Deputies took the men to a Bangor Township boat launch, where they received medical attention. One of the men was taken from there to McLaren Bay Region hospital for further treatment of non-life-threatening injuries. Neither of the two men rescued reside in Bay County, the sheriff added. Bangor Township firefighters, U.S. Coast Guard personnel, and Medstar Ambulance also assisted deputies with the incident. Want more Bay City- and Saginaw-area news?
